conclusion: Understand the movement and interaction of the objects as described in the question.

Object B is labeled and is positioned above the zigzag block.
Objects C, D, E, and F are the blocks that are currently on the couch.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and are placed at the locations of objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects A and B will replace objects C, D, E, and F on the couch.
When objects A and B come into contact with the blocks (C, D, E, and F) due to gravity, they will push the blocks out of their positions.
The blocks (C, D, E, and F) will be displaced and will fall to the floor or move to another position if there is enough space.
The blocks (C, D, E, and F) will be replaced by objects A and B, and they will settle in the positions where they were originally located.
The exact positions of the blocks after the displacement will depend on the gravitational force and the available space.
The blocks will be moved out of their original positions by the incoming objects A and B.
